title: Question 1
question: The rib cage is composed respectively by:

options.label: 10 pairs of ribs, collarbones, and sternum.
12 pairs of ribs, sternum, costal cartilages, clavicles and scapulas.
12 pairs of ribs, sternum, costal cartilages and 12 thoracic vertebrae
10 pairs of ribs, sternum, costal cartilages, clavicles and scapulas

title: Question 2
question: Of the following options, which is not part of the rib cage functions:

options.label: Protection of the contents of the thoracic cavity
Mechanics of breathing
Fix the cingulate of the upper limbs.
Prevent the expansion of the chest cavity

title: Question 3
question: The sternum consists of 3 parts, which are:

options.label: manubrium, body and xiphoid process
epiphyses and diaaphase
manubrium, diaaphase and xiphoid process
epiphyses and xiphoid process

title: Question 4
question: Of the following options, which does not correspond to the muscles of the Thorax Wall:

options.label: Upper posterior serratus, external intercostal and subcostal
External Oblique, Internal Oblique and Deltoid
Lower posterior serratus, internal intercostal and Transverse thoracic
Intimate intercostal, rib lifter and subcostal

title: Question 5
question: How many pairs of nerves is the chest wall reversed by?

options.label: 8 pairs of thoracic spinal nerves
10 pairs of thoracic spinal nerves
12 pairs of thoracic spinal nerves
14 pairs of thoracic spinal nerves

title: Question 6
question: Which arteries make up the arterial supply of the chest wall?

options.label: Lungs, heart and thymus
Trachea, esophagus and lungs
Liver, spleen and duodenum
Heart, trachea and thymus

title: Question 7
question: Of the following options, which does not correspond to structures of the thoracic cavity:

options.label: Lungs, heart and thymus
Trachea, esophagus and lungs
Liver, spleen and duodenum
Heart, trachea and thymus

title: Question 8
question: The Lungs are made up of 3 faces, which are:

options.label: Inner face, outer face and inner face
Intercostal face, pectoral face and proximal face
Pulmonary face, cardiac face and mediastinal face
Costal face, mediastinal face and diaphragmatic face

title: Question 9
question: The lungs have 3 margins, which are:

options.label: Intercostal margin, cardiac margin and posterior margin
Front margin, bottom margin and rear margin
Pulmonary margin, cardiac margin and mediastinal margin
Lower margin, upper margin and median margin

title: Question 10
question: The right lung is divided into 3 parts, which are:

options.label: Left lobe, right lobe and central lobe
Anterior lobe, posterior lobe and internal lobe
Upper lobe, central lobe and middle lobe
Upper lobe, middle lobe and lower lobe

title: Question 11
question: The ribs are classified into 3 main groups, namely:

options.label: Real ribs, fake ribs and mixed ribs
Anterior ribs, posterior ribs and lateral ribs
Real ribs, fake ribs and floating ribs
Posterior ribs, lateral ribs and mixed ribs

title: Question 12
question: The pericardium is divided into 02 layers, which are:

options.label: fibrous pericardium and serous pericardium
superior pericardium and inferior pericardium
anterior pericardium and posterior pericardium
intimate pericardium and central pericardium

title: Question 13
question: The heart is divided into 03 layers, which are:

options.label: exocardium, intracardium and myocardium
epicardium, intracardium and infracardium
epicardium, myocardium and endocardium
endocardium, intracardium and myocardium

title: Question 14
question: The heart receives venous blood through:

options.label: Superior vena cava and aorta
Pulmonary veins and inferior vena cava
Aorta and pulmonary arteries
Superior vena cava and inferior vena cava

title: Question 15
question: The heart is divided into four chambers, which are:

options.label: His bundle, aortic valve, atrioventricular valve and pulmonary trunk valve
Right and left chambers, and left and right ventricles
Left and right atriums; Left and right ventricles
Superior and inferior vena cava, pulmonary artery and aorta

title: Question 16
question: The heart is divided into 03 faces, which are:

options.label: Upper face, lower face, and medial face
Front face, vertical face and horizontal face
Anterior face (sternocostal), diaphragmatic face (lower) and central face
Anterior (sternocostal), diaphragmatic (lower) and pulmonary (left)

title: Question 17
question: Main artery responsible for the vascularization of the heart:

options.label: Aorta
Coronary arteries
Pulmonary Artery
Subclavian artery

title: Question 18
question: What is the thickest layer of the heart?

options.label: Endocardium
Myocardium
Epicardium
Mesocardium

title: Question 19
question: Which cardiac chamber is responsible for pumping blood to the body through the aorta artery?

options.label: Left atrium
Right atrium
Left ventricle
Right ventricle

title: Question 20
question:
(PUC-SP) "Through I, blood II reaches the heart and leaves the heart through the III".
In the above excerpt, I, II and III can be filled, correctly and respectively, by:

options.label: Pulmonary arteries, poor in oxygen and aortic vein.
Pulmonary veins, rich in oxygen and aortic artery.
Arteries and veins, rich in oxygen and aortic veins.
Pulmonary arteries, rich in oxygen and aortic vein.
